title: Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease and the PNPLA3 gene.
summary: Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease, a potentially fatal obesity-related condition, affects more than 70 million people in the United States. ...
abstract: Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease, a potentially fatal obesity-related condition, affects more than 70 million people in the United States. Nurses are well-positioned to impact this genetically influenced disease by is increasing awareness, providing patient education, and advocating for affected persons.
